prompt: "I wore my lucky socks and we won the game. My lucky socks caused us to win!"
hint: Just because something happened after something else doesn't mean the first thing caused the second.
explanation: This is a Post Hoc fallacy (short for 'post hoc ergo propter hoc' - after this, therefore because of this). Just because wearing the socks preceded the win doesn't mean they caused it. Correlation is not causation.
visual_concept: Post Hoc: A rooster crowing before sunrise and claiming HE made the sun come up.
